description.narrative: By the end of the intervention Expert Grup is expected to have a good understanding and apply in their work Environment and climate, gender equality perspectives and HRBA, also, in terms of organiastional development, Expert Grup will implement all the recommendations of the System Based Audit for improvement of their internal processes.

Core support to Civil Society Organisation Expert Grup. The support aims to strengthen the organization and contribute to their activities. The core support activities includes the five programs run by Expert Grup: - Organization Development - Financial and comunication - DCFTA - Sustainable development - Methodology and research - Public administration reform - Monetary sector - Financial sector - Public sector - Energy Sector

Kärnstöd till den Moldaviska civilsamhällesorganisationen Expert Grup. Stödet syftar till att stärka organisationen och bidra till deras verksamhet genom flexibel finansiering som kan användas för både projekt och löpande kostnader för verksamheten. Kärnstödeverksamheten innefattar utvecklande och stärkande av Expert Grups fyra program: - Organization Development - Financial and comunication - DCFTA - Sustainable development - Methodology and research - Public administration reform - Monetary sector - Financial sector - Public sector - Energy Sector

description.narrative: Environment mainstreaming In this section I would like to present the vision of Expert Grup on how they have integrated environment and climate and a conclusion based on observations. According to Expert-Grup, it adjusted its internal procedures in order to make the integration of environmental dimension organic and sustainable. In this regard, the policies related to employment, public procurement, financial management were adjusted accordingly. Additionally, a new policy on developing new policy documents was developed, which institutionalized the organization’s commitment to promote gender balance, environment protection and conflict resolution. Besides approval of a green office and green event policy as well as green procurement policy, Expert Grup integrated environmental perspective into its core activities. Environment objectives have become embedded into the analytical products and consulting services provided by Expert-Grup. The core support allowed Expert-Grup to extend the horizons of its activity, which was focussed mostly on economic policies, and integrate environment dimension into its activity. In particular, the organization intensified its interaction with the Ministry of Agriculture, Regional Development and Environment and built partnerships with the most active environment think-tanks and organizations by being a member of the working group dedicated to environment objectives under the EaP Civil Society National Platform. Moreover, together with such leading environmental CSOs as EcoContact and the National Center for Environment, Expert-Grup conducted joined papers, joined events and formed consortia on tenders, and most likely such partnerships will continue and expand in the future. These dimensions are already part of the organizational culture of Expert-Grup, which means that they will be continuously implemented in the future. This is one of the most important element of sustainability brought in by the core support program for Expert-Grup. At the same time, Expert Grup opposed for a long time integration of the environmental perspective, the first concrete steps have been made during and after the mid term evaluation that has shown very little progress of the organization in this regard. Currently, environment and climate is more present in Expert Grup activity due to partnerships with environmental NGOs that was encouraged in the second phase of the Swedish support. Gender mainstreaming According to Expert Grup, the core support increased the capacities of Expert-Grup to integrate gender into its activities and analytical products. Compared to the situation before the core support, the experts pay much more attention to gender disaggregated statistical data and to gender peculiarities when analysing the economic phenomena and evolutions. One of the most recent example is the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on the economy of Moldova, where Expert-Grup analysed the disproportionate impact of the pandemics, women being impacted the most because of lower revenues and economic empowerment on the one hand, and gender stereotypes in terms of taking care of children and households on the other hand. The organization developed its internal capacities to conduct gender-based budgeting. As a result, the budgetary analyses elaborated by Expert-Grup take into account the gender perspective. For example, the most recent assessment of the Law on state budget for 2021 analysed to which extend the budget addresses the needs of vulnerable groups, including women, who were mostly effected by the pandemics. These joint activities allowed Expert-Grup to learn in practice from gender experts how to integrate the gender dimension into the policy analysis and formulate gender sensitive policy recommendations. Similar to joint papers with environmental organizations, these activities laid the ground for other partnerships in the future. Established two gender focal points within the organization. The first one is the financial manager of the organization, who is taking care of the implementation and permanent improvement of the internal procedures for ensuring gender balance in employment, procurement and operation of the organization. The second focal point is specialised in streamlining the gender dimension into the analytical work and policy studies developed by the organization. Even though, there is a considerable progress of Expert Grup in integrating the gender equality aspects in comparison with the period before 2018, a deeper understanding of its importance is lacking and is depending on concrete experts involved in the development of the study.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
